verses.text_plain: I am the rose of Sharon, and the lily of the valleys.
verses.verse_html: 1I am the rose of Sharon, and the lily of the valleys.

verses.text_plain: As the lily among thorns, so is my love among the daughters.
verses.verse_html: 2As the lily among thorns, so is my love among the daughters.

verses.text_plain: As the apple tree among the trees of the wood, so is my beloved among the sons. I sat down under his shadow with great delight, and his fruit was sweet to my taste.
verses.verse_html:
3As the apple tree among the trees of the wood, so is my beloved among the sons. I sat down under his shadow with great delight, and his fruit was sweet to my taste. ▼
▼ I sat…: Heb. I delighted and sat down, etc
 , ▼
▼ taste: Heb. palate

footnotes.body_text: ▼ I sat…: Heb. I delighted and sat down, etc
footnotes.body_html: ▼ I sat…: Heb. I delighted and sat down, etc

verses.text_plain: He brought me to the banqueting house, and his banner over me was love.
verses.verse_html:
4He brought me to the banqueting house, and his banner over me was love. ▼
▼ banqueting…: Heb. house of wine

footnotes.body_html: ▼ banqueting…: Heb. house of wine

verses.text_plain: Stay me with flagons, comfort me with apples: for I am sick of love.
verses.verse_html:
5Stay me with flagons, comfort me with apples: for I am sick of love. ▼
▼ comfort…: Heb. straw me with apples

footnotes.body_text: ▼ comfort…: Heb. straw me with apples
footnotes.body_html: ▼ comfort…: Heb. straw me with apples

verses.text_plain: His left hand is under my head, and his right hand doth embrace me.
verses.verse_html: 6His left hand is under my head, and his right hand doth embrace me.

verses.text_plain: I charge you, O ye daughters of Jerusalem, by the roes, and by the hinds of the field, that ye stir not up, nor awake my love, till he please.
verses.verse_html:
7I charge you, O ye daughters of Jerusalem, by the roes, and by the hinds of the field, that ye stir not up, nor awake my love, till he please. ▼
▼ I charge…: Heb. I adjure you

footnotes.body_text: ▼ I charge…: Heb. I adjure you
footnotes.body_html: ▼ I charge…: Heb. I adjure you

verses.text_plain: The voice of my beloved! behold, he cometh leaping upon the mountains, skipping upon the hills.
verses.verse_html: 8The voice of my beloved! behold, he cometh leaping upon the mountains, skipping upon the hills.

verses.text_plain: My beloved is like a roe or a young hart: behold, he standeth behind our wall, he looketh forth at the windows, shewing himself through the lattice.
verses.verse_html:
9My beloved is like a roe or a young hart: behold, he standeth behind our wall, he looketh forth at the windows, shewing himself through the lattice. ▼
▼ shewing…: Heb. flourishing

verses.text_plain: My beloved spake, and said unto me, Rise up, my love, my fair one, and come away.
verses.verse_html: 10My beloved spake, and said unto me, Rise up, my love, my fair one, and come away.

verses.text_plain: For, lo, the winter is past, the rain is over and gone;
verses.verse_html: 11For, lo, the winter is past, the rain is over and gone;

verses.text_plain: The flowers appear on the earth; the time of the singing of birds is come, and the voice of the turtle is heard in our land;
verses.verse_html: 12The flowers appear on the earth; the time of the singing of birds is come, and the voice of the turtle is heard in our land;

verses.text_plain: The fig tree putteth forth her green figs, and the vines with the tender grape give a good smell. Arise, my love, my fair one, and come away.
verses.verse_html: 13The fig tree putteth forth her green figs, and the vines with the tender grape give a good smell. Arise, my love, my fair one, and come away.

verses.text_plain: O my dove, that art in the clefts of the rock, in the secret places of the stairs, let me see thy countenance, let me hear thy voice; for sweet is thy voice, and thy countenance is comely.
verses.verse_html: 14O my dove, that art in the clefts of the rock, in the secret places of the stairs, let me see thy countenance, let me hear thy voice; for sweet is thy voice, and thy countenance is comely.

verses.text_plain: Take us the foxes, the little foxes, that spoil the vines: for our vines have tender grapes.
verses.verse_html: 15Take us the foxes, the little foxes, that spoil the vines: for our vines have tender grapes.

verses.text_plain: My beloved is mine, and I am his: he feedeth among the lilies.
verses.verse_html: 16My beloved is mine, and I am his: he feedeth among the lilies.

verses.text_plain: Until the day break, and the shadows flee away, turn, my beloved, and be thou like a roe or a young hart upon the mountains of Bether.
verses.verse_html:
17Until the day break, and the shadows flee away, turn, my beloved, and be thou like a roe or a young hart upon the mountains of Bether. ▼
▼ of Bether: or, of division

footnotes.body_html: ▼ of Bether: or, of division
